This position will remain open for a minimum of 5 days and will accept applications on an ongoing basis until filled.
  
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination based on age, ancestry, citizenship, color, disability, gender identity or expression, genetics, marital status, national origin, political affiliation, veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any protected characteristic. For religious or disability accommodation needs, please review our accommodation information.

title: Content Creator
description:
***Vill du skapa innehåll som gör skillnad på riktigt?*** *Hos Evidensia får du använda din kreativitet för att stärka Europas ledande aktör inom djursjukvård. Varje dag hjälper vi djur och deras familjer, och ditt arbete blir en viktig del av hur vårt varumärke syns, känns och kommunicerar.*

*IVC Evidensia är Europas ledande företag inom veterinärvård med verksamhet i 20 länder. Vi har en ambitiös tillväxtresa framför oss där kombinationen av innovation och affärsutveckling spelar en central roll.*

**Om rollen:**


Som Content Creator blir du en nyckelperson i vårt svenska marknadsteam. Du utvecklar visuellt starkt och engagerande innehåll för våra digitala kanaler – från hemsida och nyhetsbrev till sociala medier och digitala annonser. Du arbetar nära vår Creative Lead och Marketing Manager för att skapa ett enhetligt, varmt och modernt uttryck som bygger varumärke, driver trafik och konvertering, och får människor att känna för Evidensia.


Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:


* Producera digitalt innehåll – grafik, bilder, animationer och video – för sociala medier, webb och annonsering.
* Skapa visuellt starka och säljande annonser, inlägg, reels och kampanjmaterial.
* Designa och förbättra landningssidor och användarupplevelser på vår webb.
* Skapa nyhetsbrev och visuellt innehåll enligt våra designriktlinjer.
* Planera och publicera innehåll i våra sociala kanaler, inklusive text/captions.
* Arbeta som både redaktör och AD: samla in berättelser från verksamheten och paketera dem till inspirerande storytelling.
* Följ upp resultat, analysera vad som fungerar och snabbt testa nya format.
* Samverka med externa fotografer, videografer och byråer.

**Vem vi tror att du är**  

Du är en kreativ doer med stark formkänsla och en passion för digitalt innehåll. Du motiveras av att förverkliga idéer, testa nytt, driva projekt och skapa visuellt uttryck som engagerar.


Du har erfarenhet av att arbeta i föränderliga miljöer och motiveras av att förverkliga idéer och skapa en visuell förändring.


*Kvalifikationer och erfarenheter*

* Relevant utbildning inom design/kommunikation
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av liknande roll
* Trygg i både grafisk design och digital innehållsproduktion
* Uppdaterad på trender i sociala medier och digitalt uttryck
* Van vid att jobba strukturerat och leverera mot aktivitetsplaner, gärna med tidigare erfarenhet av att jobba på en marknadsavdelning
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Adobe Creative Cloud
* Erfarenhet av videoredigering och mobila innehållsappar (t.ex. CapCut)
* Grundläggande kunskap i webbdesign, HTML och CSS
* Bra känsla för språk och stark tonalitet på svenska
* Det är ett plus om du gillar djur, men du behöver inte ha jobbat med djur eller djursjukvård tidigare.


Skicka gärna med din portfolio eller länk till eventuell hemsida/profil för att visa ditt tidigare arbete.

**Ort:** Kontoret ligger på Östhammarsgatan 74 på Gärdet i Stockholm, vi erbjuder viss flexibilitet i vardagen, men lägger stor vikt vid samarbete på plats.

 **Omfattning:** Heltid, provanställning 6 månader

 **Sista ansökningsdag:**  

Urval sker löpande, vi rekommenderar därför alla kandidater att ansöka så snart som möjligt. Sista ansökningsdag: 18e dec 2025.

**För information:**  

Rekryterande chef för Marknadsavdelningen i Sverige: Helena Carlberg  

  

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**

 *Evidensia Djursjukvård erbjuder trygg och personlig vård för hundar, katter, exotiska djur och hästar. På lokala djurkliniker och specialiserade djursjukhus i hela Sverige får viktiga familjemedlemmar hjälp med förebyggande friskvård, primärvård, akutvård, avancerad kirurgi och rehabilitering. Varje möte med djur och ägare ska göra skillnad och tillsammans tar våra engagerade medarbetare emot över 600 000 patientbesök per år. Tillsammans arbetar vi för att driva den veterinärmedicinska utvecklingen framåt, för djurens bästa varje dag.*

Välkommen att läsa mer om oss på vår hemsida: Välkommen till Evidensia - veterinär & djursjukvård | Evidensia
company_description: We are a global leader in veterinary care, dedicated to providing exceptional animal care. Our network of first-opinion practices, referral hospitals, and emergency care centres.

title: Vi söker en Enterprise Arkitekt med inriktning AI
description:
**Vill du vara med på resan att skapa Sveriges mest hållbara kretsloppsstad samt skapa mervärde för våra kunder så kan du vara just den personen som vi söker.**


I rollen som Enterprisearkitekt har du en central roll i att driva och leda organisationens AI-transformation och förändringsresa. Du arbetar strategiskt och operativt för att designa arkitekturer som stöttar verksamhetens mål och säkerställer att tekniska lösningar är i linje med organisationens långsiktiga behov. Du kommer att tillhöra finansavdelningen som består av ca 20 medarbetare och som arbetare inom inköp, ekonomi, IT och digitalisering.


**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**


Du arbetar nära bolagsledningen och våra verksamheter med att skapa lösningar som förenar affärsmål med tekniska möjligheter. Rollen erbjuder både strategiskt ansvar och möjligheten att arbeta hands-on med verksamhets- och systemarkitekturer men också driva större digitaliseringsinitiativ. Under det senaste året har bolaget haft ett 20-tal AI-ambassadörer som testar och arbetar med implementering i organisationen, ditt arbete blir att fortsätta och utveckla detta arbete.


I din vardag kommer du att:

* Utveckla och implementera organisationens AI-strategi och roadmap.
* Leda AI-arbetsgruppen och koordinera AI-projekt över samtliga av bolagets verksamhetsområden.
* Hantera leverantörsrelationer och teknologival inom AI-området.
* Omvärldsbevaka och ha en nära kontakt med verksamheten för att förstå det samlade behovet i bolaget.
* Bidra till att säkerställa regelefterlevnad (EU:s AI-akt, GDPR, cybersäkerhet).
* Driva organisationens AI-transformation och förändringsledning samt optimera processer, teknologier och strukturer.
* Samarbeta med bolagets ledningsgrupp och verksamhetsteam för att identifiera utvecklingsområden och skapa en gemensam målbild.
* Stötta bolagets ledningsgrupp och styrgrupper i strategiska beslut kring AI.
* Kommunicera, förmedla och utbilda övergripande kring metoder, principer och riktlinjer inom AI-området.
* Driva större AI och digitaliseringsinitiativ.

**Din bakgrund och personliga egenskaper**

Vi söker dig som har jobbat med att utveckla, driva och leda AI-implementation i liknande organisation. Kunskap och kännedom om olika typer av modeller, metoder och ramverk för arkitekturarbete är också meriterande.


Du behöver vara drivande och van att leda andra i projektledande former samt ha erfarenhet att leda och driva förändrings- och utvecklingsarbete inom AI-området.


Rollen kräver att du är självständig och tillsammans med andra kan ansvara för, planera och genomföra aktiviteter för att nå uppsatta mål. Du är driven, nyfiken och med en ständig strävan att utveckla dina kunskaper och skapa nya relationer. Du är en ledare och lagspelare med ett coachande förhållningssätt och har god samarbetsförmåga och kan anpassa ditt arbetssätt efter situationen.

**Kvalifikationer:**

* Minst 10 års erfarenhet av arbete som Enterprise Arkitekt, verksamhetsarkitekt eller i en liknande roll.
* Erfarenhet av att driva AI-, data- eller analysrelaterade initiativ med tydlig koppling till affärsresultat.
* Erfarenhet av att modellera arkitekturer på olika nivåer, inklusive verksamhets-, informations- och tekniska lager.
* God förståelse för hur AI kan användas i praktiken – exempelvis inom automatisering, analys, affärsutveckling eller kundupplevelse.
* Erfarenhet kring AI plattformar och olika AI/språkmodeller.
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
* Förmåga att förklara komplexa koncept på ett enkelt och engagerande sätt för olika målgrupper.
* God förståelse för verksamhetsprocesser, informationshantering och systemarkitektur.
* Erfarenhet av förändringsledning, affärsutveckling och att leda större digitaliseringsinitiativ.
* Erfarenhet av att leda workshops, genomföra strategiska analyser och kommunicera med beslutsfattare på hög nivå.
* Relevant högskoleutbildning eller annan utbildning som arbetsgivaren bedömer som likvärdig


Då du kommer röra dig mellan våra anläggningar så ställs krav på B-körkort.


Utöver ovan ser vi nedan erfarenheter som meriterande:

* Kunskap inom molnarkitektur, systemintegration eller moderna plattformar (t.ex. Azure, AWS, Google Cloud).
* Kännedom om Design Thinking, Business Design eller Data Strategi.
* Erfarenhet av branscher som Borås Energi och miljö verkar inom.

**Vad erbjuder vi?**


Vi värnar om goda förutsättningar för ett hållbart arbetsliv för våra medarbetare med god arbetsmiljö och möjlighet till ständig utveckling. För att uppnå detta erbjuder vi en arbetsplats med utvecklande arbetsuppgifter i en spännande bransch. Vi satsar på personalens hälsa med flera friskvårdsförmåner och aktiviteter. Vi har konkurrenskraftiga anställningsvillkor och goda förmåner som komplement. Kretslopp, omtanke och framåt är våra värdeord som avspeglar sig både inom bolaget och ut till kunder.


Alla ledare på bolaget arbetar efter en ledarskapsplattform där fokus ligger på utveckling, prestation, engagemang och att agera som goda föredömen.

**Bra att veta**

Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid (provanställning kan förekomma) med start snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Placeringen är i huvudsak på vår anläggning på Sobacken, men du kommer i din vardag att vara på samtliga av våra anläggningar.


Välkommen med din ansökan senast den 7e december. Urval sker löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. För mer information om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Finanschef Linda Syversen via e-post; linda.syversen@borasem.se


Som ett led i att vara en attraktiv arbetsgivare och i vårt säkerhetsarbete genomför vi bakgrundskontroller samt alkohol- och drogtester på alla som är aktuella för anställning hos oss.

 *Vår vision är att tillsammans med boråsarna skapa Sveriges mest hållbara kretsloppsstad. Borås Energi och Miljö ansvarar för infrastruktur i Borås såsom fjärrvärme, avfallshantering, vatten och avlopp. Vi har över 350 medarbetare hos oss och 98 olika yrken. Omsättningen uppgår till cirka en miljard. Bolaget ingår i Borås Stadshus och är en av Borås mest spännande och utvecklande arbetsplatser.*

*Vi ska spegla våra kunder såväl som samhället i stort och är beroende av medarbetare med olika kompetenser. Vi strävar efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund och värdesätter den kunskap och erfarenhet det medför.*

*Inför varje rekrytering tar vi beslut om vilka rekryteringskanaler vi ska använda och därför undanber vi oss ytterligare erbjudanden om kompetensförmedling, annonserings- och rekryteringshjälp.*

title: BI, AI & Analytics-konsult
description:
Som BI, AI & Analytics-konsult på Mindcamp kommer du att arbeta i uppdrag inom BI, AI och analytics, från behov till lösning, samt arbeta nära kunder för att förstå deras utmaningar. Du kommer att arbeta i flera kundprojekt parallellt och få möjlighet att arbeta med moderna BI och AI-verktyg som Power BI, Qlik, Copilot, Open AI samt modellera data, skriva SQL, bygga pipelines och visualiseringar. Vi söker dig med 2–3 års erfarenhet inom analytics/BI, gärna som konsult. Du bör vara trygg i SQL och ha erfarenhet av BI-verktyg samt molnmiljöer, som Azure eller Snowflake. Fördelar inkluderar en flexibel lönemodell och en kultur som värdesätter gemenskap, frihet att växa och möjligheten att bli expert inom ditt område.

**Vad du kommer göra**
----------------------

* Delaktig i uppdrag inom BI, AI och analytics – från behov till lösning
* Jobba nära kund för att förstå utmaningar och föreslå rätt väg framåt
* Ha flera kundprojekt parallellt där du får både variation och ansvar
* Arbeta i moderna BI-verktyg som Power BI eller Qlik
* Modellera data, skriva SQL, bygga pipelines och visualiseringar
* Vara en aktiv del av vårt nätverk – där vi hjälps åt, lär oss nytt och har kul

**Vi tror att du...**
---------------------

* Har 2–3 års erfarenhet av analytics/BI – gärna som konsult
* Trivs i gränslandet mellan data, affär och teknik
* Behärskar SQL och något BI-verktyg som Power BI eller Qlik
* Har gärna jobbat i molnmiljöer som Azure, Qlik Cloud, eller Snowflake
* Gillar att ta ansvar för både leverans och relationer

**3 skäl att campa med oss**
----------------------------

**Du saknar att ha kollegor – på riktigt.**  

När vi jobbar ute hos kund gör vi det alltid med en trygg teamkänsla som grund. Vi bollar idéer, löser problem och ger råd – teamet på Mindcamp är alltid nära, oavsett uppdrag. Det är roligare och bättre än de klassiska resursuppdragen där man sitter ensam. Vår starka tillhörighet är en stor del av vårt engagemang.

**Du vill gå din egen väg.**  

Vi värdesätter frihet att växa som konsult utan fasta mallar, att kunna påverka beslut och själv styra din utveckling. Därför har vi en egen lönemodell där du väljer hur mycket du vill lägga på pension, friskvård eller utrustning – varje månad.

**Du vill bli spetsig.**  

Att jobba på Mindcamp innebär att vara expert. Vi älskar vårt arbete och brinner för att dela kunskap. Hos oss får du de verktyg och det stöd du behöver för att växa – samtidigt som du ser vilken skillnad ditt arbete gör för både kunder och kollegor.

title: Solutions Architects inom Data, Cloud, Integration eller IIoT!
description:
*På TechSeed är vi övertygade om att det är tekniken som kommer göra världen till en bättre plats. Vi ser ett stort behov i vårt samhälle att kombinera affärsförståelse, digitalt ledarskap samt innovativa arbetssätt och lösningar med framtidens tekniker i uppkopplade ekosystem. Vi tror på en hållbar framtid med säkra lösningar genom exempelvis IoT-lösningar, digitala tvillingar, AI och cybersäkerhet. Det här är vårt WHY och det fyller oss med energi varje dag. Det här är vår arena.*


TechSeed är ett medarbetarägt konsultbolag på en kraftig tillväxtresa och söker efter fler lösningsarkitekter som även kommer få en stor grad av inflytande och insyn i hur vi växer framåt. Vi bygger med ambitionen att ta ett helhetsgrepp om uppkopplade ekosystem och lösningar, från kretskort till digital tvilling, och söker dig som trivs i konsultrollen och samtidigt vill bidra till att skapa vägen framåt för TechSeed – **Tillsammans**.


Vi söker fler kollegor inom flera områden, men vi tror du kommer trivas om du är lösningsarkitekt med fokus på exempelvis:

* Systemutveckling
* Integration
* Cloud
* Cyber Security
* Embedded Software (C, C++)
* IoT, IIoT, Industriautomation, OT
* Data
* Innovation


Som delägare och anställd kommer du kunna vara med i utvecklingen av våra erbjudanden, medverka i exempelvis vårt Centre of Excellence inom Architecture, få möjlighet att påverka de områden som du drivs av och samtidigt få tryggheten av ett team med gemensamt mål och gemensamma intressen.

  


**Vem söker vi?**


Vi söker dig vars expertis är arkitektur! Vi söker dig som är nyfiken på ny teknik, trivs i roller där du utvecklas och trivs i en kultur där vi hjälps åt och bygger bolaget **tillsammans**. För att trivas behöver du ha **minst 5 års erfarenhet som lösningsarkitekt, teknisk arkitekt eller liknande roll**. Du behärskar relevanta **språk, ramverk, tekniker** och **metoder** för ditt område samt är lösningsorienterad och trivs i **samarbete** med andra. Eftersom vi arbetar med flera typer av kunder med olika behov krävs det för rollen att vara **o****behindrad i både svenska och engelska**, tal och skrift. Det är även meriterande om du har tidigare erfarenhet av jobba som **konsult** och har specifik branschkompetens inom exempelvis Automotive.

title: Staff Engineer
description:
**Staff Engineer (Back‑End/Platform)**
======================================

* **Scale the Systems Powering the Energy Transition**

  

At **Greenely**, we’re building the next generation of cloud‑native energy systems that process real‑time data from millions of connected devices. Our mission is simple but bold: help households lower energy consumption and accelerate the shift toward a more sustainable future.
As a **Staff Engineer (Back‑End/Platform)**, you’ll lead cross‑team architecture and be a hands‑on builder. You’ll set technical direction for high‑scale data and API systems, raise the bar on reliability and developer experience, and create a psychologically safe environment where engineers can do the best work of their careers.

**What you’ll lead**
--------------------

* **Own technical strategy** for key platform domains (e.g., real‑time ingestion, time‑series storage, APIs, event pipelines), balancing performance, reliability, and cost.
* **Level up the platform**: establish standards for testing, observability (metrics/logs/traces), CI/CD and deployment, and resiliency (SLOs, error budgets, incident response).
* **Drive cross‑team initiatives**: author and review RFCs, define service boundaries and contracts and lead design reviews that align product, data, and platform needs.
* **Mentor and educate**: coach senior and junior engineers, model inclusive communication, and foster psychological safety—invite dissenting views and make trade‑offs explicit.
* **Ship meaningful outcomes**: contribute code in Python; guide migrations, de‑risk complex changes, and improve developer productivity (tooling, guardrails, docs).

**What you’ll bring**
---------------------

* **Extensive** back‑end experience with deep proficiency in **Python** and distributed systems.
* A track record designing and scaling **APIs and data platforms** handling high‑volume **time‑series/real‑time data** under performance constraints (REST/gRPC, Django/FastAPI, PostgreSQL, Aerospike, Redis).
* Practical expertise with **microservices, containers, and cloud** (AWS preferred), plus infrastructure as code (**Terraform**), and orchestration (**Kubernetes**).
* Comfort with **event‑driven** patterns and streaming/messaging (e.g., Kafka/Kinesis/SNS/SQS) and strong data‑modeling instincts.
* Experience implementing and operating application performance monitoring (APM) and full observability systems—metrics, logs, and distributed tracing—and using these insights to design, scale, and maintain highly reliable distributed services
* Proven ability to **lead through influence**: communicate clearly with engineers and stakeholders, write crisp design docs, and challenge assumptions respectfully (“dare to speak up”).
* Commitment to **security, privacy, and reliability** by default; experience running on‑call and post‑incident learning.
* **Fluency in English**; Swedish is a plus.

**Bonus points**
----------------

* Experience with **IoT** data pipelines, MQTT/edge connectivity, or device telemetry at scale.
* Observability at scale (**OpenTelemetry**), performance tuning, and **FinOps/cost** optimization.
* Experience with data engineering tools such as Apache Iceberg, Airflow, Spark or DBT
* Leading large migrations (e.g., monolith services, storage transitions, multi‑region).

**What success looks like (first 6–12 months)**
-----------------------------------------------

* A clear architectural roadmap for a core domain, executed via collaborative RFCs and phased delivery.
* Improved availability, and measurable reduction in incident frequency/severity.
* Standardized **design review** and **SLO** practices adopted across teams; stronger developer experience and velocity.
* Mentored engineers stepping up to lead components and cross‑team efforts.

**Why join Greenely?**
----------------------

* **Tech with purpose:** Tackle high‑impact platform challenges that directly help people reduce energy use and CO₂ emissions.
* **Impact at scale:** Shape cloud‑native systems processing real‑time data from smart meters and edge‑connected devices.
* **Growth and influence:** Your decisions will guide how we design, scale, and evolve our backend architecture and developer experience.
* **Culture and benefits:** Wellness allowance (5,000 SEK/year), paid wellness hour, private health insurance, occupational pension, competitive salary, and a centrally located office at Vasagatan 40. We value in‑person collaboration and offer flexibility: **4 days in the office and 1 day remote per week**.
* **Start date:** Flexible
* **Location:** **Stockholm, Sweden**

  

*Greenely is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive, psychologically safe environment for all employees.*

**About Greenely**

  

Greenely is on a mission to create the best customer experience for the modern energy consumer through technology. As a digital energy provider, we help people reduce their electricity costs by optimizing their home and car's electricity usage with our smart app. Supported by Nordic venture capital companies, we aim to enable households worldwide to connect, control, and optimize their energy usage. We believe that the best electricity is the one that is never used - a win-win for both wallets and the environment!

  

WE ARE **bold and push the limit.**

WE **energize each other.**

WE **t****hink like owners.**

WE **lead with knowledge.**

 *Please note that we do not accept applications via email as we protect your privacy.*  

  

*We kindly request recruitment agencies to refrain from contacting us regarding this position as we handle our recruitment efforts in-house. Thank you for your understanding.*

title: Senior C++ Engineer
description:
**About us**


Soundtrack is a B2B scale-up company providing music streaming services for businesses. We serve small customers like the café around the corner, and much bigger brands like Joe & the Juice, Toni & Guy and TAG Heuer. On the inside, we're a bunch of talented, motivated and humble designers, engineers and music experts. We believe in product-led growth, where the product is the primary driver of customer acquisition, conversion and expansion.

 **The Role**


We’re looking for a Senior Software Developer with strong experience in C++ and a passion for building seamless audio experiences. You’ll join **Play & Control,** the team responsible for ensuring that music plays beautifully and reliably across all our platforms.


While the "Control" side focuses on orchestration and coordination, you will join the "Play" side that owns the playback engine itself: how music is rendered, synchronized, and streamed. This is a high-impact role shaping the future of Soundtrack’s technology. You’ll work with a small, experienced team to evolve our in-house playback library - the critical layer connecting our backend to the app experience.  

  

**Responsibilities**


In this role, you will together with the team:

* **Architect and maintain** our cross-platform playback ability - Today it's a cross-platform C++ library, but there might be other solutions going forward.
* **Design and optimize** the playback library that powers music streaming, ensuring low latency and high fidelity.
* **Modernize existing systems**, driving architectural decisions for refactoring and adopting new technologies.
* **Collaborate across teams** (frontend, platform, and backend) to ensure seamless integration across mobile, desktop, and embedded devices.
* **Guarantee performance** across diverse environments (Linux, Windows, Android, iOS, macOS).
* **Innovate** by exploring improvements in audio processing, network resilience, and cloud connectivity
  


**About You**


Just like us, you love music. You're curious, open-minded, and driven by craftsmanship. You thrive in collaborative environments, enjoy solving complex technical challenges, and take pride in building systems that people can rely on every day.


You’re comfortable diving deep into existing code, exploring how everything fits together, and then making it better. You value quality, understand performance, and see the beauty in well-structured, maintainable systems.  

  

**Requirements**

* 5+ years of professional experience as a software engineer.
* Strong experience with C++.
* Proven ability to build and maintain cross-platform codebases.
* Solid understanding of systems programming, async design patterns, memory management, and performance optimization.
* Comfortable collaborating in a distributed, cloud-based environment


**Beneficial**

* Experience with build systems like **CMake**.
* Background in **audio streaming** or real-time media processing.
* Experience working with Linux-based embedded systems, specifically Yocto.
* Familiarity with other languages in our stack: Scala, Rust, Swift, Kotlin or Go.
* Exposure to cloud-based infrastructure (Kubernetes, GCP).
* Interest in music technology and sound systems
  


**Employee Benefits**

* We offer a flexible workplace with the possibility to work remotely
* Generous pension plan
* Yearly budget for health, wellness and personal development
* Laptop and mobile phone of your choice with included cellular subscription
* Regular social activities such as team events, meet ups, after works and off-sites
* Daily breakfast served at the office


At Soundtrack, we believe that diversity fuels creativity and innovation. We're committed to building a team that reflects a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences. We welcome applications from individuals of all races, ethnicities, genders, ages, abilities, religions, sexual orientations, and identities.


We reserve the right to close this vacancy early if we identify a suitable candidate before the application deadline. To ensure consideration, we encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible.


If you have any questions about the position or need to reach out, get in touch with Henrik Jonhed at henrik@soundtrack.io. Please note that we only accept applications submitted via our career page and do not accept applications by e-mail.

title: Data Centre Technician Manager
description:
**Overview**  

As a Microsoft Data Center Technician (DCT) Manager, you will lead a team of technicians, providing guidance on performing hardware deployments, diagnostics on equipment, and hardware decommissions. You will support technician performance, prioritizing technician tasks while monitoring Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Service Level Agreements (SLAs). This opportunity will allow you to model leadership principles, provide training to technicians, and accelerate your career growth in the process. Microsoft’s Cloud Operations & Innovation (CO+I) is the engine that powers our cloud services. As a CO+I DCT Manager, you will perform a key role in delivering the core infrastructure and foundational technologies for Microsoft's online services including Bing, Office 365, Xbox, OneDrive, and the Microsoft Azure platform. As a group, CO+I is focused on the personal and professional development of all employees and offers training and growth opportunities including Career Rotation Programs, Diversity & Inclusion training and events, and professional certifications. Our infrastructure is comprised of a large global portfolio of more than 200 data centers in 32 countries and millions of servers. Our foundation is built upon and managed by a team of subject matter experts working to support services for more than 1 billion customers and 20 million businesses in over 90 countries worldwide. With environmental sustainability and optimization at the forefront of our data center design and operations, we continue to grow and evolve as we meet the ever-changing business demands that hold Microsoft as a world-class cloud provider. Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.  

  

**Responsibilities**  

 Responsibilities - Accountable for end-to-end people management activities such as recruitment, performance assessments, resource scheduling and regular bi-weekly one-on-one meetings with a team of Data Center Technicians. - Delivering success through empowerment and accountability by modeling, coaching, and caring while promoting a positive and effective team culture. - Lead team and triage meetings, prioritizing work across your team, and rebalance priorities to respond to changes. - Accountable for overall data center service compliance and quality. - Ensures technicians are trained in procedures for installation, deployment, replacement, and post-execution quality check processes. - Verify that post-execution quality checks have been performed appropriately by technicians and take corrective action as needed. - Escalate issues through appropriate channels and follow up on issue resolution, sharing knowledge related to issue resolution with appropriate teams. - Complete required safety training, conduct daily safety briefings, and participate in on-site safety committees. - Ensure technicians and vendor resources comply with all safety procedures (e.g., Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) usage, equipment use, lifting, electrical hazards, ladder use). - Promote a culture of safety and empower technicians to act, speak up, and report safety concerns and/or incidents. - Has pride and a sense of accountability for the service quality, completeness, and resulting customer experience, displaying accountability and ownership of the data center facilities. - Embody our culture and values.  

  

**Qualifications**  

Required Qualifications - High school diploma, GED, or equivalent and basic knowledge of computer hardware and components AND 3+ years’ experience supporting IT equipment or related technology or related experience working with technical teams. - 1+ year(s) experience directing, supervising, or managing others. Background Check Requirements: Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: - Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter. While not required, we also look for the following Preferred Qualifications: - Associate degree in Computer Science or related field and/or equivalent work experience. - 4+ years’ experience supporting IT equipment or related technology. - 3+ years’ experience working in a production, mission-critical 24x7x365 data center environment. - Applicable certifications: Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) Foundation, ASICS/Inventory Control, CompTIA (A+, Server+, Network+), Basic Structure Cabling (BSC), Certified Data Center Professional (CDCP), Microsoft Certified Professional (MCP), Six Sigma Green Belt). - 2+ years’ experience leading diverse, technical, or IT workforce of up to ten employees. Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form. Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.  

  

This position will be open for a minimum of 5 days, with applications accepted on an ongoing basis until the position is filled.

  

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance with religious accommodations and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about **requesting accommodations.**
company_description: Our mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more.

title: Solutions Engineer (Infrastructure)
description:
**Job Requisition ID #**
 25WD92668
   

  

**Position Overview**
 We are a team of solution engineers within our Named Accounts sales organization, supporting the entire EMEA region. We get to work with some of our most innovative and dynamic customers, helping them identify new ways to solve their business problems using our technology.
   

  

 Our team is growing, with leaders who are committed to supporting growth and development so we can be our very best. We like to think of ourselves as “technical domain experts” because we have the capacity, flexibility, and permission to challenge the status quo, fail fast, and try new things, all in support of growing our customers’ use of our technology.
   

  

**Responsabilities**
 In this role, you’ll get to showcase your industry and software workflows expertise by partnering with customers. You’ll ask questions, show empathy, and speak their language, taking their problems and translating them into solutions that meet their needs (which equals growth for us!).
   

  

* Collaborate with everyone across the Named Accounts sales and account teams, from account executives, technical solutions executives, and enterprise account sales executives to customer success managers, consulting, and technical account specialists
* Work directly with customers, from site operatives all the way to the C-suite, via workshops, scoping pilots, on-site visits, and more
* Propose ways to improve or solve customer problems, connecting the solutions to customer needs and highlighting the value provided
* Support strategic engagements within Autodesk to promote and grow our relationships
* Be part of a team that loves learning and tackling problems together
* Have a growth mindset, and bring your own experiences and ideas to the table to build on our shared success


**Minimum Qualifications**
* Experience influencing and shaping the delivery of projects and/or contracts in the infrastructure design and construction sectors (specifically transportation – road, rail, airport, and water distribution)
* Hands-on knowledge of Autodesk solutions and workflows in the infrastructure industry
* A solution-focused approach to solving problems
* A technical mindset, curiosity and capacity to learn new technologies
* Fluent in Business English
* Ability to travel up to 30% within the EMEA region, some global travel


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Additional languages per location
* Hands-on technical knowledge of competitive solutions (eg. Bentley)
* Understanding of platform technologies such as (but not limited to) APIs, Plugin development, visual scripting and AI workflows applied to the infrastructure industry
* Effective communication, presentation, and group facilitation skills
* Experience or interest in sales-supporting function (e.g., presales)
* Desire to manage influence through persuasion, negotiation, and consensus-building
* Network builder, someone who is comfortable in building meaningful relationships
* Works without supervision and can manage multiple priorities
* Knowledge of social media to strengthen industry profile and drive awareness with customers


****Learn More****
**About Autodesk**
 Welcome to Autodesk! Amazing things are created every day with our software – from the greenest buildings and cleanest cars to the smartest factories and biggest hit movies. We help innovators turn their ideas into reality, transforming not only how things are made, but what can be made.
   

  

 We take great pride in our culture here at Autodesk – it’s at the core of everything we do. Our culture guides the way we work and treat each other, informs how we connect with customers and partners, and defines how we show up in the world.
   

  

 When you’re an Autodesker, you can do meaningful work that helps build a better world designed and made for all. Ready to shape the world and your future? Join us!
   

  

**Salary transparency**
 Salary is one part of Autodesk’s competitive compensation package. Offers are based on the candidate’s experience and geographic location. In addition to base salaries, our compensation package may include annual cash bonuses, commissions for sales roles, stock grants, and a comprehensive benefits package.
   

  

**Sales Careers**
 Working in sales at Autodesk allows you to build meaningful relationships with customers while growing your career. Join us and help make a better, more sustainable world. Learn more here: https://www.autodesk.com/careers/sales
   

  

**Diversity & Belonging**
 We take pride in cultivating a culture of belonging where everyone can thrive. Learn more here: https://www.autodesk.com/company/diversity-and-belonging
   

  

**Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk?**
 Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site).

title: Accountant
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.
   

  

  

  

**The role of an Accountant at Canonical:**
 If you are passionate about the technology industry and want to work for a company that aligns with your interests, we might be the place for you! Canonical, and our world class Ubuntu product, attracts some of the leading talent from around the world. Come and work with exceptional people and advance your career in Finance!
   

  

 Our Finance team is growing and it's a really exciting time to join the team. We are looking for bright, motivated people who have a passion for making a difference. You will be seeking an opportunity to drive process improvements and change, input your ideas and truly contribute to a highly productive team.
   

  

 We are looking for an exceptional Accountant with IFRS experience to help us ready the business for public market scrutiny through our planned IPO. The right candidate will have domain expertise and a passion for IFRS.
   

  

**Location:** 
 This role may be office based in London, or Remote in EMEA Time Zones.
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

* Assist in the month end reporting process to deliver timely and accurate information
* Have full responsibility for a part of the ledger processes relevant to your strengths
* Assist with the year end audit process and statutory reporting
* Support the finance team's wider plans to prepare for an IPO
* Improve the efficiency of financial processes and procedures and monitor compliance
* Share knowledge between team members to ensure cover is available when needed
* Actively develop your own skills to ensure current knowledge of applicable standards and regulations
* Establish strong relationships with key colleagues outside the wider finance team


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Exceptional academic track record and subsequent career performance
* Bachelor's degree in Accounting or equivalent
* Qualified accountant (ACCA, ACA, ACMA, CPA, etc.)
* Experience at a large public accounting firm, or public multinational corporate accounting department preferred
* NetSuite or similar enterprise grade systems experience
* Willingness to travel up to four times per year


**What we offer colleagues**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Mechanical Engineer
description:
**Scope of the assignment**


The tasks shall include but not limited to:
  

* Work as integral member of the Neutron Chopper Work package.
* Supporting the delivery of Tranche 2 and 3 Scientific Instruments.
* Integrate components designed in our partner facilities and manage their integration into the ESS Master CAD model
* Participate directly in the system assembly, machine installation and relevant operations: Activities and work can take place on surface assembly halls (laboratories).
* Generate, maintain and update 2D drawings in CATIA environment and interact/archive them in CHESS (the ESS in-house CAD management software tool).
* Generate 2D design from 3D input.
* Generate 3D model from 2D input.
* Generate 2D and 3D from Requirements input.
* Generation and updates of conceptual, draft, detailed and manufacturing 2D drawings (and 3D models) in CATIA V6.
* Produce, update and review technical documentation.
* Provide installation coordination on site, Generate 2D installation drawings and documentation.
* Follow-up manufacturing of components, monitor production performance and conduct engineering quality and acceptance inspections.
* Document and present your work as appropriate.
* Reviewer responsibility in the Mechanical Engineering discipline, drawings, and engineering packages.
* Review 2D drawing according to mechanical standardization norms and codes for but not limited to GPS tolerancing, ISO, etc.

Self-manage and self-prioritization skills are necessary.**Technical & Engineering skills & background**

* Higher Technical or University engineering degree in mechanical engineering or other closely equivalent engineering degree
* Knowledge of basic mechanical engineering
* Knowledge of additive or composite manufacturing
* Minimum 2 years of CAD mechanical design engineering experience
* Minimum 1 years of working experience in CATIA design
* Experience with application of coatings based on epoxy resins
* Experience on tooling design
* Experience with design maturity, versioning and release
* Previous work experience in scientific facility is a bonus.
* Experience with Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing and its application to production drawings
* Experience and knowledge of maintenance drawings and installation drawings (also industrial) will be an asset.
* Experience and knowledge of technical documentation and configuration management will be an asset.
* Relevant experience in designing mechanical apparatuses fulfilling specific needs for accelerator and detector environments will be an asset.
* Engineering experience on any of the following technologies: radiation background, vacuum, pressure, gas flow, magnetic field, low-frequency radiofrequency, high temperature, cryogenic, or electrical and electronics will be considered an asset.

 **Behavioral**

* Showing initiative: Demonstrate self-motivation is essential.
* Managing self: working well autonomously; taking on activities and tasks without prompting; projecting self-confidence when presenting ideas, proposals, and opinions.
* Following orders: Communicating effectively with the goal to understand and follow orders, propose technical solutions at the direction set from management.
* Demonstrating flexibility: adapting quickly and resourcefully to shifting priorities and requirements.
* Demonstrates an understanding of how one issue may be a part of a much larger system. Produces pragmatic and workable solutions to a range of problems.
* Achieving results: having a structured and organized approach towards work; being able to set priorities and plan tasks with results in mind; delivering high quality work on time and fulfilling expectations; producing comprehensive work / project plans considering resources and contingencies.
* Adaptability, good communication skills and the ability to identify issues and proactively work to solve them are necessary to perform well in this position.
* Adaptability to the continuously updating and changing project needs and flexibility to manage work according to project needs.
* Excellent oral and written English skills are prerequisites; knowledge of other European language(s) would be an advantage.

title: Lab Engineer Tissue
description:
**About Justera Group**  

Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.  

  

**About the Role:**  

This role sits within the Professional Hygiene laboratory, supporting the full product system for a leading hygiene product range with a strong focus on dispensers. As a Laboratory Engineer, you will represent the laboratory across multiple functions, support innovation projects, and contribute to product development by conducting thorough testing on tissue materials, dispenser mechanics, and complete product systems. You will collaborate closely with laboratory colleagues, product developers, and innovation teams to deliver product improvements and new solutions.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Plan, propose, and perform evaluation and laboratory testing on products.
* Present, document, and report test results clearly and accurately.
* Conduct analyses and statistical evaluations to support technical conclusions.
* Maintain up-to-date knowledge of laboratory test methods.
* Develop, evaluate, and validate new laboratory methods when required.
* Develop and maintain testing equipment, tools, and related setups.
* 

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree (BSc) in a relevant technical field such as Textile, Mechanical, or Chemical Engineering.
* Experience in laboratory work or product testing in a global environment is an advantage.
* Preferably experienced in statistical analysis and using analytical tools or programs.
* Strong communication and presentation skills, both in writing and verbal discussions.
* Fluency in written and spoken English.
* 

**What We Offer:**

  

* A dynamic and innovative workplace driving advancements in cutting-edge robotic technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance
* 25 days of annual leave to recharge and relax
* An annual wellness allowance of 3,500 SEK to support your health and wellbeing

title: Product Development Engineer
description:
**Join Our Growing Team**

**BE AWAKE FOR THE FIRST TIME IN YOUR LIFE**

 **About the role:**


As a Product Development Engineer within the Quality Department you will play a key role in ensuring that our beds maintain Hästens’ renowned standards of craftsmanship and performance. At Hästens we improve the life of our customers by giving them the best possible sleep through our products. In this role, you will combine engineering expertise with a passion for quality, transforming horsehair, cotton, wool, wood, and other natural materials into products that embody extraordinary comfort and timeless excellence.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Participate in and contribute to product development projects, with a focus on bed products.
* Act as a component expert within the bed category, maintaining deep knowledge of all relevant components and materials.
* Support material selection and development with a focus on durability and natural materials.
* Develop and review CAD models, technical drawings, and production documentation.
* Coordinate and lead prototype builds, ensuring efficient execution and accurate documentation.
* Plan and execute design validation and performance testing to verify functionality and quality.
* Contribute to supplier quality assurance through material evaluations, audits, and consistency checks.
* Lead or support root cause analysis and corrective actions for product or material deviations.
* Work closely with suppliers as a technical requirement setter and development partner.
* Ensure manufacturability and cost efficiency in collaboration with production and sourcing teams.
* Prepare detailed production documentation, including Bills of Materials (BOMs) and assembly instructions., together with our Product Engineering & Compliance team.
* Collaborate with other internal teams to ensure design integrity and craftsmanship.
* Support and participate in continuous improvement initiatives, including Change Board activities.
* Travel to suppliers and production sites to strengthen relationships and maintain our high standards.

**Skills and requirements**:

* Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Product Development, or related field.
* Solid experience in Product Development, ideally within the furniture industry.
* Proficiency in CAD software (e.g., SolidWorks, CATIA, or similar).
* Good understanding of wood and textile materials.
* Hands-on experience with prototype building and workshop tools.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.
* Willingness to travel and work closely with international suppliers.

**About us:**

  

Since 1852, Hästens Beds has been committed to crafting the best sleep. The skilled craftspeople at our factory in Köping, Sweden, have been refining our work for generations. Every bed is bespoke and made by hand using only the best natural materials. The difference lies in the details and our quest to provide the most restful sleep for people who want to lead a higher quality of life. We are proud to be a world-class international brand, operating in more than 40 countries with over 300 partners in Europe, Asia, America and Africa – and still growing.

title: C++ Developer
description:
Professional Galaxy is looking for a
 **C++ Developer** 
 for one of our clients.
   

  

**Assignment Description**
 C++ Developer – create world-class leading products
   

  

 We are looking for a software developer with a passion for C++.
   

  

 As software developer you are part of a multinational and 400 people strong R&D department in Nacka that creates innovative assembly systems. You will be part in developing high-quality software in an agile environment close to the customer and in every step of the way - from initial idea to final product and closely to our customers. We have been turning industrial ideas into business-critical benefits since 1873 and our assembly systems are used by customers world-wide, for example in automotive, aerospace, electronics, and wind power industries.
   

  

**Your main responsibilities:**
* Analyze customer needs, design and implement software in C++, write unit tests, and write documentation.
* Work continuously against a better software and process environment.


 What you can expect from us
   

  

**Your profile:**
* A technical university degree, a Master of Science in Software Engineering, or significant programming experience.
* C++ programming skills. Linux and embedded systems knowledge are needed.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken, for collaboration in multinational teams.


**Other relevant information:**

**Application deadline:** 
 2025-11-25

title: Fullstack-utvecklare till växande psykologföretag - timanställning - distans
description:
Vill du vara med och bygga framtidens digitala vårdupplevelse? Hos oss på Svea KBT / Elly Care får du utveckla plattformar som gör verklig skillnad för människors psykiska hälsa — och bidra till vår mission: Bästa patientresan.
   

  

 Om rollen
   

  

 Som Fullstack-utvecklare är du en nyckelperson i vårt tekniska team. Du arbetar med allt från front-end-design till back-end-logik och systemarkitektur. Du bygger skalbara, snabba och tillgängliga lösningar som stärker våra digitala tjänster inom psykisk hälsa.
   

  

**Det här är en timanställning som passar dig som vill ha flexibilitet** 
 men ändå vara en central del av ett kunnigt, kreativt och lösningsorienterat utvecklingsteam.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som känner igen dig i följande:
   

  

 Tekniska färdigheter
   

  

 Du har mycket god teknisk bredd och djup, och känner dig hemma i hela stacken:
   

  

**Front-end & design**
* God känsla för design och användarupplevelse
* Arbetar obehindrat i Figma
* Mycket goda kunskaper i HTML, CSS och SCSS – och kan bygga responsiva gränssnitt
* Mycket goda kunskaper i JavaScript, jQuery och Vue.js
* Erfarenhet av moderna byggprocesser (Vite, NPM)


**WordPress-utveckling**
* Förstår WordPress både invändigt och utvändigt
* Erfarenhet av Gutenberg-redigeraren och kan utveckla egna Gutenberg-block
* Arbetar vant med Advanced Custom Fields (ACF)
* Kan utveckla egna WordPress-plugins och teman


**Back-end & servermiljö**
* Mycket goda kunskaper i PHP och förståelse för MVC-struktur
* Erfarenhet av Laravel-ramverket och utveckla REST API
* Goda kunskaper i SQL och relationsdatabaser
* Känner till verktyg som Composer, Supervisor och PM2
* Förstår servermiljöer (Apache, NGINX) och har vana av Linuxterminalen
* Känner till verktyg som Supervisor och PM2


**Verktyg & versionshantering**
* Arbetar strukturerat med Git och har vana av samarbete i kodbaser
* Har ett öga för prestanda, säkerhet och underhållbar kod


 För att trivas i rollen är du en person som…
   

  

* Gillar att skapa ordning och tydlighet även i komplexa system
* Tänker proaktivt och ser snabbt hur saker kan förbättras eller automatiseras
* Trivs med ansvar och gillar att ta projekt från idé till färdig lösning
* Är nyfiken på nya tekniker och gillar att testa, lära och dela med dig
* Är prestigelös – redo att göra det som krävs för att skapa fungerande och snygga lösningar
* Kommunicerar tydligt och samarbetar gärna med design-, marknads- och vårdteam


 Om Svea KBT & Elly Care
   

  

 Vi är en av Sveriges mest snabbväxande aktörer inom psykisk hälsa. Vår vision är att skapa Bästa patientresan — en vårdupplevelse som är sömlös, empatisk och effektiv.
   

  

 Vi arbetar med KBT, psykologisk behandling och neuropsykiatriska utredningar, både digitalt och på plats i våra mottagningar.
   

  

 Som utvecklare hos oss är du med och formar hur tusentals människor möter vården – från första kontakt till avslutad behandling.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder
   

  

* En varm, prestigelös och kreativ kultur där teknik möter samhällsnytta
* Flexibilitet i arbetstid och arbetsplats
* Möjlighet att påverka både teknikstack och arbetssätt
* Ett team som gillar att tänka högt, testa nytt och bygga smarta lösningar


 Praktisk information
   

  

* Anställningsform: Timanställning
* Omfattning: Enligt överenskommelse
* Ort: Stockholm (hybrid eller distans kan förekomma)
* Kontakt: matz.bengtsson@sveakbt.se / patrik.bergqvist@sveakbt.se
* Ansökan: Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt – urval sker löpande

title: Data–ML Platform Engineer
description:
**About Kambi**
*Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.*
*Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.*
**Purpose**
 Be part of a highly skilled, self-organized engineering team building scalable data and machine-learning infrastructure in the cloud. You’ll help design and evolve event-driven data pipelines and model-serving capabilities that power high-value decision-making across the business, working closely with key stakeholders and quantitative analysts to turn complex data into actionable insights and deliver Player and Risk Management products.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Collaborate with engineers and analysts to design, implement, and maintain cloud-native data and ML services.
* Build and optimize streaming and batch data workflows with Kafka, dbt/SQL, and related technologies.
* Develop robust backend components and services in Java/Spring Boot and contribute to model-serving capabilities in Python where appropriate.
* Contribute to architectural discussions and propose practical solutions in a fast-moving, exploratory environment.
* Champion best practices in testing, monitoring, and observability to keep data products reliable and secure.


**Desired Skills & Experience**
*(You don’t need to tick every box, strong skills in several areas plus willingness to learn are what matter most.)*
* Java/Spring Boot expertise (core requirement).
* Proficiency in Python for data and ML workflows.
* Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or similar) and modern CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Jenkins, Argo CD).
* Familiarity with Kafka and dbt/SQL for streaming and transformations.
* Experience with Spark or similar distributed processing frameworks is a plus.


**Personal Qualities (Critical for Success)**
* Driven & Self-Motivated – thrives when goals evolve and problems are ambiguous.
* Communicative & Collaborative – shares ideas openly and builds trust across disciplines.
* Curious & Adaptive – eager to explore new tools and approaches.
* Humble & Team-Oriented– values collective achievement in a highly self-organized team.


 Interested in learning more? Please submit your CV and a cover letter — we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 #wearekambi
   

  

***Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace***
*If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.*
***Creating an inclusive environment***
*We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.*
*#wearekambi*
